intro: Leiotulus alexandrinus, commonly known as the Alexandrian spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a cyathium, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. It is native to regions of southern Africa and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
